qas.question: How many parts did the Gregorian calendar reform have?
What was the first reform concerning the calendar?
What was the second reform of the calendar?
What was calculated using the lunar calendar?
What did Lilius's calendar plan to reduce in every 400 years?
How many parts did the Gregorian reform have?
What calendar was changed by the Julia reform?
What reform change the lunar cycle used by pagans?
Who oppose the proposal for the reform?
Whose reform included increasing the number of leap years and for centuries?

context: <b7_0>The Gregorian reform<b7_0/> contained <a0_0><b5_0>two parts<b5_0/><a0_0/>: a reform of the <a1_0><b6_0>Julian calendar<b6_0/><a1_0/> as used prior to Pope Gregory XIII's time and a reform of the <a2_0>lunar cycle<a2_0/> used by the Church, with the Julian calendar, to calculate the <a3_0>date of Easter<a3_0/>. The reform was a modification of a proposal made by <b8_0><b9_0>Aloysius Lilius<b9_0/><b8_0/>. His proposal included reducing the <a4_0>number of leap years<a4_0/> in four centuries from 100 to 97, by making 3 out of 4 centurial years common instead of leap years. Lilius also produced an original and practical scheme for adjusting the epacts of the moon when calculating the annual date of Easter, solving a long-standing obstacle to calendar reform.
